newsitem.title: ITALY: IRI supports STET in Italy's cordless phone row.
newsitem.headline: IRI supports STET in Italy's cordless phone row.

text.p: Italy's state industrial holding group IRI said it supports the view of telecoms holding group STET that a new cordless phone to be launched by Telecom Italia does not abuse its dominant position in fixed-line telephony.

President of Italy's anti-trust authority Giuliano Amato said on Wednesday that the new phone system called Fido using the Digital European Cordless Telephony (DECT) standard, would take advantage of Telecom Italia's fixed-line dominant position.

Support for STET came from IRI director Roberto Tana after a meeting with the managing directors of Italy's three state-controlled telecoms group Ernesto Pascale at STET, Francesco Chirichigno at Telecom Italia and Vito Gamberale at TIM.
"IRI shares the position of STET," said Tana when leaving the meeting.
IRI controls around 64 percent of STET, with the telecoms group set for privatisation by early 1997. STET itself holds majority shareholding in Telecom Italia and Telecom Italia Mobile(TIM).
